name: Smith Machine Slight Incline Press
how_to_perform:
1. Adjust the Smith machine to a slight incline (about 15-20 degrees) and adjust the bar to your chest height.

2. Lie on your back underneath the bar, with your shoulders directly under the bar.

3. Grip the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing forward.

4. Press the bar upwards by straightening your arms fully, extending them from the shoulders to lock out the elbows.

5. Lower the bar down carefully until it's almost touching your chest. Focus on using your chest muscles to control the movement.

6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement before pressing the bar back up to the starting position.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your core engaged and focusing on controlled movements throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Smith Machine Slight Incline Press is a chest press exercise performed on a Smith machine with a slight incline to target the upper chest muscles.
